1.text: Dare any of you, having an affair with another, be judged by the unjust, and not by the holy ones?

2.text: Know ye not that the holy ones shall judge the world? and if the world be judged by you, are ye unworthy of the least judgments?

3.text: Know ye not that we shall judge messengers? also not only things pertaining to the cares of life?

4.text: Therefore truly, if ye have judgments pertaining to the cares of life, set them counted as nothing in the church.

5.text: For confusion I speak to you. So is there not one wise with you, who will be able to judge between his brother?

6.text: But brother with brother is judged, and this by the unbelieving.

7.text: Therefore truly, already is there wholly a misfortune in you, that ye have judgments with yourselves. Wherefore had ye not rather be treated ill? wherefore had ye not rather be defrauded?

8.text: But ye treat ill, and defraud, and that the brethren.

9.text: Or know ye not that the unjust shall not inherit the kingdom of God Be ye not deceived: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor effeminate, nor sodomites,

10.text: Nor thieves; nor covetous, nor intoxicated, nor railers, nor rapacious, shall inherit the kingdom of God.

11.text: And these were some of you: but ye were washed, but ye were consecrated, but ye were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus, and in the Spirit of our God.

12.text: All things are lawful to me, but all are not profitable: all are lawful to me, but I will not be exercised by power under any.

13.text: Foods for the belly, and the belly for foods: and God will also leave unemployed this and them. And the body not for fornication, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.

14.text: And God also raised up the Lord, and us will he also raise up by his power.

15.text: Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Christ? having taken the members of Christ, shall I make members of a harlot? It may not be.

16.text: Or know ye not that he joined to a harlot is one body? for they shall be, he says, they two into one flesh.

17.text: And he joined to the Lord is one spirit.

18.text: Flee fornication. Every sin which if a man do is without the body; but he committing fornication sins against his own body.

19.text: Or know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit in you, which ye have from God, and ye are not your own?

20.text: For ye were bought for a price: then glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are of God.
